alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades; Kittitas Valley; Simcoe Highlands; Yakima Valley (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued February 26 at 4:28PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RAIN AND SNOW MELT WILL RESULT IN THE THREAT OF RIVER FLOODING MONDAY NIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY ON SMALL STREAMS AND RIVERS IN PARTS OF CENTRAL AND SOUTH CENTRAL WASHINGTON... A series of wet weather systems impacting the region will result in rain and snow melt Monday into Thursday. This will lead to quick rises on the Klickitat, Naches, and Yakima Rivers. Minor flooding of small streams and creeks will also be possible across the area, especially along the east slopes of the Washington Cascades. Please monitor the latest river forecasts from the National Weather Service at: Water.weather.gov/ahps2/area.php?wfo=pdt&hydro_type=0&hsa_type=1

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades; Kittitas Valley; Simcoe Highlands; Yakima Valley
